str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
Adverb from the base of pou; an interrogative particle of manner; in what way?; also as exclamation, how much!

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To proclaim, herald, preach. Of uncertain affinity; to herald, especially divine truth.
If. From ei and an; a conditional particle; in case that, provided, etc.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Passive - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From apo and stello; set apart, i.e. to send out literally or figuratively.
According to the manner in which, in the degree that, just as, as. From kata and hos; just as, that.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A primary verb; to 'grave', especially to write; figuratively, to describe.
Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.
Fair, beautiful, blooming. From hora; belonging to the right hour or season, i.e. flourishing (figuratively).
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
The foot. A primary word; a 'foot'.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle - Genitive Masculine Plural
str2: From eu and aggelos; to announce good news especially the gospel.
